alert.note: Alert for Mercer (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 29 at 6:57AM EDT until May 29 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Virginia and southeast West Virginia, including the following counties, in southwest Virginia, Bland, Giles, Pulaski, Tazewell and Wythe. In southeast West Virginia, Mercer. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 657 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Back Creek, Cove Creek, Bentley Branch, Big Spring Branch, East Fork Indian Grave Creek, Burkes Garden Creek, Crab Orchard Creek, Bluestone River, Dismal Creek, East Fork Cove Creek and Altoona Branch. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bluefield... Pulaski... Wytheville... Bland... Bastian... Rocky Gap... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
